snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg reiterated Wednesday that the New York City Marathon would be run on Sunday, and organizers were prepared to scale back related events.
abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg says New York City Marathon will go on as scheduled, despite aftermath of Hurricane Sandy; plan to go forward is being met with backlash from area residents and even many registered runners who believe it is in poor taste to hold race as hundreds of thousands of people in region continue to suffer damage wrought by storm.

byline.original: By KEN BELSON and MARY PILON

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg reiterated Wednesday that the New York City Marathon would be run on Sunday, and organizers were prepared to scale back related events.

headline.seo: New York City Marathon to Go On, Stirring Debate
headline.main: Marathon Is Set to Go On, Stirring Debate
headline.print_headline: Marathon Is Set to Go On, Stirring Debate
